{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.12035v1", "title": "Enhancement of primordial curvature perturbations in $R^3$-corrected
  Starobinsky-Higgs inflation", "summary": "We provide a systematic study of the Starobinsky-Higgs inflation model in the
presence of an additional cubic term of the Ricci scalar. We investigate, in
particular, the effects of the cubic term on the spectral index $n_s$ and the
tensor-to-scalar ratio $r$. Through both analytical and numerical analyses, we
show that the $R^3$-corrected Starobinsky-Higgs model can achieve compatibility
with cosmic microwave background observations while producing distinct
observational signatures with different frequency ranges. In addition, we
discuss the complementarity between different observational probes, including
the scalar-induced gravitational waves and spectral distortions, offering an
independent probe of the enhanced curvature perturbations. Detection prospects
are also discussed.", "main_category": "astro-ph.CO", "categories": "astro-ph.CO,hep-ph", "published": "2025-04-16T12:49:39Z"}
